channel.title: Comments on: The History of HTML Table Layouts
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: traingamer
item.dc:creator: traingamer
item.description: CSS doesn't take longer once you've done a few pages. In fact, it's usually quicker because it's so much cleaner and easier to modify.
item.content:encoded: CSS doesn’t take longer once you’ve done a few pages. In fact, it’s usually quicker because it’s so much cleaner and easier to modify.

item.title: By: Amelia @ IT Management
item.dc:creator: Amelia @ IT Management
item.content:encoded:
Tables and inline formatting are very much used in the writing of e-newsletters with simpler layouts. Most of the time, it’s table-free layout.

I wonder how e-mail clients and e-mail providers (e.g. gmail, yahoo, hotmail) render HTML5.
